message: a year ago i used clojure quite a lot but last time i checked clojure hasn't changed much. What do you think?
I agree Mark, it sure does sound like a troll since there have been major changes in the Clojure world in the last year...

lol, no, the question was serious. I was coding in clojure from 1.0 on and liked it very much and also realized a project with it but since then I got the feeling it went very quiet in the clojure land. I know there has been development since then. It's just a feeling and I just wanted to have a discussion about clojure as the "channel" is really empty for now (still) :).
As for this "channel" being quiet - I'm not sure how popular Convore really is? IRC is pretty hopping all day long (250 folks in that channel right now). #clojure on freenode.

Well, Clojure/core just posted a list of tickets to be addressed at part of Release.Next and are talking about a beta release (of 1.3.0). A bug fix release for 1.2.0 was recently delivered (1.2.1). The old contrib library has been broken up into modules as part of the 1.3.0 development and now maintainers are stepping up to promote certain key contrib libraries to new namespaces alongside clojure.core (I volunteered to work on clojure.java.jdbc, formerly clojure.contrib.sql). So, huge changes :)
is there a resource for keeping abreast of the clojure community, packages, etc?
The main Clojure mailing list on Google Groups?
Was looking for something more like an aggregate so I don't have to follow that list (although I do, currently)
I'm brand new to Clojure, but the community seems vibrant.  Google Group is active, and there's a ton of github projects related to the language.  See: http://clojars.org/
